Its key features are its retro-inspired styling, which pays homage to the original 124 Spider, and its engaging, nimble handling. The starting price for the FIAT 124 Spider is $25,390.

car_models.name: FIAT 500

summary.engine_and_performance: 1.3L diesel engine.
summary.key_features: Retro styling and a range of customization options.
summary.price: Last recorded price was around ₹14.93 Lakh in India.

car_models.corpus: The FIAT 500 is a compact city car known for its iconic retro styling. In the Indian market, it was available with a 1.3L diesel engine. Its key features are its charming, vintage-inspired design and a wide range of customization options that allow for personalization. The last recorded price in India was around ₹14.93 Lakh.

car_models.name: FIAT 500L

summary.engine_and_performance: Available with a range of petrol and diesel engines.
summary.key_features: A spacious and versatile interior.
summary.price: Production has ended in many markets, but used models are available.

car_models.corpus: The FIAT 500L is a compact MPV (Multi-Purpose Vehicle) that expands on the 500's styling with a much more spacious and versatile interior. It was available with a range of petrol and diesel engines. Its primary key feature is its roomy and flexible cabin, designed to offer more practicality than the standard 500. Production has ended in many markets, but used models are available.

car_models.name: FIAT 500X

summary.engine_and_performance: 1.3L turbocharged 4-cylinder with 177 hp.
summary.key_features: Retro styling and standard all-wheel drive.

car_models.corpus: The FIAT 500X is a compact crossover that applies the 500's retro styling to an SUV body. It is powered by a 1.3L turbocharged 4-cylinder engine with 177 horsepower. Key features include its distinctive Italian design and standard all-wheel drive, providing added capability and confidence in various weather conditions. A 2022 model had a starting price of $29,560.

car_models.name: FIAT 500e

summary.engine_and_performance: All-electric vehicle with a range of up to 149 miles.
summary.key_features: Electric version of the Fiat 500 with cute retro styling and a modern interior.

car_models.corpus: The FIAT 500e is the all-electric version of the Fiat 500, offering a driving range of up to 149 miles. Its key features are its cute, retro-inspired styling, zero-emission electric powertrain, and a modern, stylish interior, making it an appealing choice for urban commuting. The 2025 model has a starting price of $30,500.

car_models.name: Ford Ecosport

summary.engine_and_performance: Available with a 1.5L petrol or diesel engine.
summary.key_features: A range of features and a comfortable ride.
summary.price: Last recorded price was in the range of ₹8.19 - ₹11.69 Lakh in India.

car_models.corpus: The Ford Ecosport was a compact SUV offered with a choice of a 1.5L petrol or a 1.5L diesel engine in India. It was known for its comfortable ride and a good range of available features for its segment. The last recorded price in India for the Ford Ecosport was in the range of ₹8.19 to ₹11.69 Lakh.

car_models.name: Ford Edge

summary.engine_and_performance: 2.0L turbocharged 4-cylinder with 250 hp.
summary.key_features: A smooth ride and a roomy cabin.

car_models.corpus: The Ford Edge is a mid-size SUV that provides a smooth ride and a roomy cabin for passengers. It is powered by a 2.0L turbocharged 4-cylinder engine that produces 250 horsepower. Its key features are its comfortable and quiet ride quality and its spacious two-row interior, making it a pleasant vehicle for daily driving and road trips. The 2024 model starts at $39,960.

car_models.name: Ford Escape

summary.engine_and_performance: Available with a 1.5L turbo, a 2.0L turbo, and two hybrid options.
summary.key_features: A spacious and comfortable interior and a user-friendly infotainment system.

car_models.corpus: The Ford Escape is a compact SUV available with a wide range of engines, including a 1.5L turbo, a 2.0L turbo, and two hybrid options (a standard hybrid and a plug-in hybrid). Key features include a spacious and comfortable interior and a user-friendly SYNC infotainment system. The 2026 model of the Ford Escape is priced starting at $30,050.

car_models.name: Ford Expedition

summary.engine_and_performance: 3.5L EcoBoost V6 engine.
summary.key_features: Seating for up to eight passengers and a large cargo area.
summary.price: Starting at $55,630 for a 2024 XL STX model.

car_models.corpus: The Ford Expedition is a full-size SUV powered by a 3.5L EcoBoost V6 engine. It is designed for large families or those with significant hauling needs, offering key features such as seating for up to eight passengers and a massive cargo area. The 2024 XL STX model has a starting price of $55,630.

car_models.name: Ford Explorer

summary.engine_and_performance: Available with a range of engines, including a 4.0L V6 and a 4.6L V8 in older models.
summary.key_features: A long history of being a popular family vehicle.
summary.price: Varies significantly by year and model.

car_models.corpus: The Ford Explorer is a popular three-row SUV with a long history as a family vehicle. In older models, it was available with a range of engines, including a 4.0L V6 and a 4.6L V8. Its enduring key feature has always been its ability to serve as a versatile and capable family hauler. The price for an Explorer varies significantly depending on its year and model.

car_models.name: Ford F-150

summary.engine_and_performance: Available with a wide range of engines, including a hybrid option.
summary.key_features: A range of trims, a high towing capacity, and an available onboard generator.
summary.price: Starting at $39,645 for a 2025 XL model.

car_models.corpus: The Ford F-150 is a full-size pickup truck, one of the best-selling vehicles in America. It is available with a wide range of engines, including a hybrid option. Its key features include a diverse lineup of trims, a high towing and payload capacity, and an available Pro Power Onboard generator that turns the truck into a mobile power source. The 2025 XL model starts at $39,645.

car_models.name: Ford Fiesta

summary.engine_and_performance: 1.5L diesel engine.
summary.key_features: A focus on fuel efficiency and a fun-to-drive character.
summary.price: Last recorded price was in the range of ₹8.63 - ₹10.31 Lakh in India.

car_models.corpus: The Ford Fiesta was a subcompact car known for its fuel efficiency and fun-to-drive character. In India, it was available with a 1.5L diesel engine. Its key features were its agile handling, which made it enjoyable to drive, and its economical operation. The last recorded price in India was in the range of ₹8.63 to ₹10.31 Lakh.

car_models.name: Ford Flex

summary.engine_and_performance: 3.5L V6 engine.
summary.key_features: A distinctive boxy design and a spacious interior.
summary.price: Production has ended, but used models are available.

car_models.corpus: The Ford Flex was a unique three-row crossover with a distinctive, boxy design that resembled a modern station wagon. It was powered by a 3.5L V6 engine. Its key features were its standout styling and an exceptionally spacious interior that offered generous room for passengers in all three rows. Production of the Flex has ended.

car_models.name: Ford Fusion

summary.engine_and_performance: Available with a range of engines, including a 2.5L 4-cylinder, a 1.5L turbo, a 2.0L turbo, and a hybrid option.
summary.key_features: A comfortable ride and a range of available technology features.
summary.price: Production has ended, but used models are available.

car_models.corpus: The Ford Fusion was a mid-size sedan available with a wide range of engines, including a 2.5L 4-cylinder, a 1.5L turbo, a 2.0L turbo, and a hybrid option. It was known for its comfortable ride and the availability of numerous technology features. Production has since ended, but used models remain a popular choice.

car_models.name: Ford Mustang

summary.engine_and_performance: Available with a 2.3L EcoBoost 4-cylinder or a 5.0L V8 engine.
summary.key_features: A classic design and a focus on performance.
summary.price: Starting at $31,920 for a 2025 EcoBoost Fastback.

car_models.corpus: The Ford Mustang is an iconic pony car with a classic design and a focus on performance. It is available with a 2.3L EcoBoost 4-cylinder engine or the legendary 5.0L V8 engine. Its key features are its timeless fastback design, powerful engine options, and its legacy as a cultural icon. The 2025 EcoBoost Fastback model starts at $31,920.

car_models.name: Ford Ranger

summary.engine_and_performance: Available with a 2.3L EcoBoost 4-cylinder or a 3.0L EcoBoost V6.
summary.key_features: A range of off-road capabilities.

car_models.corpus: The Ford Ranger is a mid-size pickup truck available with a 2.3L EcoBoost 4-cylinder or a more powerful 3.0L EcoBoost V6 engine. A key feature of the Ranger is its range of off-road capabilities, especially in trims like the Tremor or the high-performance Ranger Raptor. Pricing is available from Ford dealers.

car_models.name: Ford Super Duty F-250

summary.engine_and_performance: Available with a 6.8L or 7.3L gas V8, or a 6.7L Power Stroke turbo diesel V8.
summary.key_features: A high towing capacity and a range of work-oriented features.
summary.price: Starting at $45,300 for a 2025 XL model.

car_models.corpus: The Ford Super Duty F-250 is a heavy-duty pickup truck built for extreme towing and hauling. It is available with a 6.8L or 7.3L gas V8, or a 6.7L Power Stroke turbo diesel V8. Its key features are its immense towing capacity and a range of work-oriented features designed for the toughest jobs. The 2025 XL model starts at $45,300.

car_models.name: Ford Taurus

summary.engine_and_performance: 2.0L EcoBoost turbocharged 4-cylinder with 240 hp.
summary.key_features: An elegant design and a spacious interior.
summary.price: Starting at AED 1.0 lacs in the UAE for a 2025 model.

car_models.corpus: The Ford Taurus is a full-size sedan that features an elegant design and a spacious interior. In some markets, it is offered with a 2.0L EcoBoost turbocharged 4-cylinder engine producing 240 horsepower. Key features include its sophisticated styling and a roomy, comfortable cabin. A 2025 model in the UAE has a starting price of AED 1.0 lacs.

car_models.name: Ford Transit Connect Wagon

summary.engine_and_performance: Available with a 3.5L V6 engine.
summary.key_features: Seating for up to 15 passengers.
summary.price: Starting at $56,400 for a 2025 Passenger Van XL.

car_models.corpus: The Ford Transit Connect Wagon is a compact passenger van, which in its larger Transit configurations, can be equipped with a 3.5L V6 engine. A key feature is its ability to seat up to 15 passengers, making it ideal for commercial or large group transport. The 2025 Passenger Van XL model starts at $56,400.

car_models.name: Toyota Camry

summary.engine_and_performance: Standard 2.5L 4-cylinder hybrid powertrain; front-wheel or all-wheel drive.
summary.key_features: Toyota Safety Sense 3.0, large touchscreen infotainment, available leather interior.

car_models.corpus: The Toyota Camry stands as a titan in the mid-size sedan segment, globally recognized for its unwavering reliability and exceptional value. The 2025 model year marks a significant evolution, as Toyota has transitioned the Camry to an exclusively hybrid lineup, underscoring a commitment to efficiency. The standard powertrain combines a 2.5-liter 4-cylinder engine with electric motors, delivering smooth acceleration and impressive fuel economy, with options for both front-wheel and all-wheel drive. A cornerstone of its appeal is the comprehensive Toyota Safety Sense 3.0 suite, which equips the vehicle with a vast array of active safety and driver-assistance features. Inside, the cabin is modern and driver-focused, featuring a large central touchscreen, comfortable seating, and high-quality materials, especially in higher trims like the XLE and XSE which offer luxurious leather interiors. Its new 'hammerhead' front fascia lends it a sharp, contemporary look, ensuring the Camry remains a top contender for families and commuters seeking a practical, safe, and highly dependable sedan.

car_models.name: Honda CR-V

summary.engine_and_performance: 1.5L turbocharged engine or 2.0L hybrid powertrain; available AWD.
summary.key_features: Spacious cargo area, Honda Sensing suite, available 9-inch touchscreen, Real Time AWD.

car_models.corpus: The Honda CR-V has long been a benchmark in the highly competitive compact SUV class, praised for its remarkable blend of practicality, efficiency, and user-friendly design. It offers two excellent powertrain choices: a responsive 1.5-liter turbocharged engine for the standard models and an advanced 2.0-liter two-motor hybrid system that provides a quiet, efficient, and surprisingly brisk driving experience. Honda's Real Time AWD is available for enhanced traction and stability in adverse conditions. One of its most significant key features is its class-leading interior space, providing generous room for passengers and a cavernous cargo area that rivals larger vehicles. Every CR-V comes standard with the Honda Sensing suite, a collection of safety features including collision mitigation braking and adaptive cruise control. The interior is defined by a clean, modern aesthetic with high-quality materials and an available 9-inch touchscreen infotainment system, making it a comfortable and dependable choice for a wide range of buyers.

car_models.name: Tesla Model Y

summary.engine_and_performance: Dual-motor all-wheel drive; Long Range and Performance variants.
summary.key_features: Minimalist interior with 15-inch touchscreen, Autopilot, available third-row seating, expansive glass roof.
summary.price: Starting around $45,000 for a 2025 Long Range model.

car_models.corpus: The Tesla Model Y has fundamentally reshaped the automotive landscape, becoming one of the world's best-selling electric vehicles. It delivers a compelling combination of range, performance, and cutting-edge technology within a practical compact SUV body. Available in Long Range and Performance variants, both featuring a dual-motor all-wheel-drive system, the Model Y offers breathtaking acceleration and a confident, planted feel on the road. Its interior is a study in minimalism, dominated by a central 15-inch touchscreen that controls nearly all vehicle functions. This is complemented by an expansive all-glass roof that creates an open, airy cabin. Key features that define the Tesla experience include the advanced Autopilot driver-assistance system, access to the vast and reliable Supercharger network for long-distance travel, and continuous over-the-air software updates that introduce new features and improvements over time. The Model Y also offers a unique, albeit compact, optional third row of seats, adding a layer of versatility not common in its class.

car_models.name: Porsche 911

summary.engine_and_performance: New 3.6L flat-six T-Hybrid powertrain (GTS); rear-engine, RWD or AWD.
summary.key_features: Iconic silhouette, driver-focused cockpit, Porsche Communication Management (PCM), advanced aerodynamics.
summary.price: Starting around $120,000 for a 2025 Carrera model.

car_models.corpus: The Porsche 911 is more than just a sports car; it is an automotive icon that has been continuously refined for over six decades while retaining its unmistakable rear-engine silhouette. The latest 992.2 generation represents a landmark moment, particularly with the introduction of the new T-Hybrid system in the GTS models. This innovative, lightweight hybrid powertrain uses an electric motor to boost performance and eliminate turbo lag, enhancing the driving experience without the weight of a large plug-in battery. The 911's cockpit is a masterclass in design, perfectly blending a high-tech digital instrument cluster and a modern Porsche Communication Management (PCM) system with a layout that remains resolutely driver-focused. Its handling dynamics are legendary, offering a level of feedback and precision that few competitors can match. From the base Carrera to the all-wheel-drive Turbo S, the 911 lineup offers a vast spectrum of performance, all underpinned by unparalleled engineering and a timeless appeal.

car_models.name: Land Rover Defender

summary.engine_and_performance: Range of engines including inline-6 mild-hybrid and supercharged V8.
summary.key_features: Monocoque chassis, Terrain Response 2 system, Pivi Pro infotainment, available in 90, 110, and 130 body styles.

car_models.corpus: The modern Land Rover Defender successfully resurrects a legendary nameplate, masterfully blending its historic, go-anywhere capability with the comfort and technology expected of a modern luxury SUV. Built on a robust aluminum monocoque chassis, it offers a surprisingly refined on-road ride without compromising its world-class off-road prowess. This capability is managed by the highly intelligent Terrain Response 2 system, which can automatically optimize the vehicle's settings for various challenging surfaces. The Defender's interior is a unique mix of rugged utility and premium materials, featuring exposed structural elements alongside the sophisticated Pivi Pro infotainment system. A key feature is its versatility, offered in three distinct body styles: the compact 2-door 90, the standard 4-door 110, and the extended-length 130 model with seating for up to eight. This makes the Defender a uniquely compelling option, equally at home on a remote trail or navigating city streets.

car_parts.name: AIR COMPRESSOR

summary.function: Compresses air for various systems, including air suspension and air conditioning.
summary.key_features: Horsepower (HP), air tank capacity, and maximum flow rate.

car_parts.corpus: An Air Compressor is a mechanical device in a vehicle that serves the function of compressing air for use in various systems, such as air suspension and air conditioning. Key features to consider when choosing one include its horsepower (HP), the capacity of its air tank, and its maximum flow rate, which together determine its performance. The price for an automotive air compressor can range widely from ₹800 to over ₹20,000.

car_parts.name: ALTERNATOR

summary.function: Charges the battery and powers the electrical system when the engine is running.
summary.key_features: Amperage output, compatibility with your vehicle.

car_parts.corpus: The Alternator is a critical component of a vehicle's electrical system. Its function is to charge the battery while the engine is running and to power the vehicle's entire electrical system. When replacing an alternator, key features to consider are its amperage output, which must meet the vehicle's electrical demands, and ensuring it is compatible with the specific vehicle model. Prices can range from ₹10,000 to over ₹85,000.

car_parts.name: CAMSHAFT

summary.function: Controls the opening and closing of the engine's valves.
summary.key_features: Lift and duration for performance applications.
summary.price: Prices vary widely based on the vehicle and type of camshaft.

car_parts.corpus: A Camshaft is a rotating shaft within an engine whose function is to control the opening and closing of the engine's intake and exhaust valves. In performance applications, the key features to consider are the camshaft's lift and duration, which determine how far the valves open and for how long, directly impacting the engine's power characteristics. The price of a camshaft varies widely based on the vehicle and the type of camshaft.

car_parts.name: CRANKSHAFT

summary.function: Converts the linear motion of the pistons into rotational motion.
summary.key_features: Forged vs. cast construction for strength.

car_parts.corpus: The Crankshaft is a fundamental engine component that functions to convert the linear, up-and-down motion of the pistons into the rotational motion needed to power the vehicle. A key feature to consider, especially for high-performance engines, is its construction material, with forged crankshafts offering greater strength and durability compared to cast ones. The price can range from as low as ₹150 to over ₹38,000.

car_parts.name: CYLINDER HEAD

summary.function: Sits on top of the engine block and houses the valves, spark plugs, and fuel injectors.
summary.key_features: Material (aluminum or cast iron), port design.

car_parts.corpus: The Cylinder Head is a major engine component that sits on top of the engine block. Its function is to house crucial parts like the valves, spark plugs, and fuel injectors, and to form the top of the combustion chamber. Key features to consider include its material, typically aluminum or cast iron, and the design of its intake and exhaust ports, which affect airflow and performance. The price of a cylinder head varies greatly by vehicle.

car_parts.name: DISTRIBUTOR

summary.function: Distributes high voltage from the ignition coil to the spark plugs in the correct firing order.
summary.key_features: Electronic vs. points-based systems.

car_parts.corpus: Found in older vehicles with non-electronic ignition systems, the Distributor's function is to route the high voltage from the ignition coil to the spark plugs in the correct firing order. A key feature is the type of system it uses, with older vehicles using points-based systems and later models using more reliable electronic systems. The price of a distributor varies depending on the specific vehicle.

car_parts.name: ENGINE BLOCK

summary.function: The main structure of the engine that houses the cylinders and other major components.
summary.key_features: Material (cast iron or aluminum), deck height, bore size.

car_parts.corpus: The Engine Block is the core foundation of an internal combustion engine. Its primary function is to house the cylinders and provide a rigid structure for all other major engine components to attach to. Key features of an engine block include its material (cast iron or aluminum), its deck height, and its cylinder bore size, which all play a role in the engine's overall design and potential. The price varies significantly depending on the engine.

car_parts.name: FUEL INJECTOR

summary.function: Sprays fuel into the engine's cylinders.
summary.key_features: Flow rate, impedance.

car_parts.corpus: A Fuel Injector is a precision component whose function is to spray a fine mist of fuel into the engine's cylinders or intake manifold. Key features to consider when selecting fuel injectors are their flow rate, which must match the engine's fuel requirements, and their impedance (high or low), which must be compatible with the vehicle's engine control unit. The price per injector can range from $12 to over $155.

car_parts.name: IGNITION COIL

summary.function: Transforms the battery's low voltage to the high voltage needed to create a spark.
summary.key_features: Coil-on-plug vs. distributor-based systems.

car_parts.corpus: The Ignition Coil's function is to act as a high-voltage transformer, converting the battery's low 12-volt current into the thousands of volts needed to create a spark at the spark plug. A key feature is the type of ignition system it's designed for, such as modern coil-on-plug systems or older distributor-based systems. The price for an ignition coil varies depending on the vehicle.

car_parts.name: OIL FILTER

summary.function: Removes contaminants from the engine oil.
summary.key_features: Filtration efficiency, capacity.

car_parts.corpus: An Oil Filter is a disposable component with the crucial function of removing contaminants, such as dirt and metal particles, from the engine oil. Key features to consider when choosing an oil filter are its filtration efficiency, which indicates how well it cleans the oil, and its capacity. Prices for oil filters in India typically range from ₹900 to over ₹2,400.

car_parts.name: OIL PAN

summary.function: Reservoir for the engine oil at the bottom of the engine.
summary.key_features: Material (steel or aluminum), capacity.

car_parts.corpus: The Oil Pan is located at the bottom of the engine and functions as a reservoir for the engine oil. Key features to consider include its material, which is typically steel or aluminum, and its capacity, as a larger capacity can aid in cooling and ensure adequate oil supply during aggressive driving. The price of an oil pan varies by vehicle.

car_parts.name: OXYGEN SENSOR

summary.function: Measures the amount of oxygen in the exhaust gases to help the engine run efficiently.
summary.key_features: Upstream or downstream sensor, connector type.

car_parts.corpus: An Oxygen Sensor is a critical emissions control device whose function is to measure the amount of unburned oxygen in the exhaust gases. This data helps the engine's computer adjust the air-fuel mixture for optimal efficiency and minimal emissions. Key features include its location (upstream before the catalytic converter, or downstream after it) and its specific connector type. The price varies by vehicle.

car_parts.name: PISTON

summary.function: Moves up and down in the cylinder to compress the air-fuel mixture and transmit power to the crankshaft.
summary.key_features: Forged or cast, compression ratio.

car_parts.corpus: A Piston is a cylindrical component that moves up and down within an engine's cylinder. Its function is to compress the air-fuel mixture and to transmit the force of combustion down to the crankshaft via a connecting rod. Key features include its construction (forged or cast) and its design, which affects the engine's compression ratio. The price for a piston can range from ₹270 to over ₹50,000.

car_parts.name: SPARK PLUG

summary.function: Creates a spark to ignite the air-fuel mixture in the cylinder.
summary.key_features: Material (copper, platinum, iridium), heat range.

car_parts.corpus: A Spark Plug is a small but essential device whose function is to create an electrical spark to ignite the compressed air-fuel mixture inside the cylinder. Key features to consider are the electrode material (copper, platinum, or iridium, which affects longevity) and the plug's heat range, which must match the engine's operating conditions. The price in India can range from ₹60 to over ₹3,500.

car_parts.name: STARTER

summary.function: An electric motor that turns the engine over to start it.
summary.key_features: Amperage draw, gear reduction.

car_parts.corpus: The Starter is an electric motor with the sole function of turning the engine over (cranking it) to initiate the combustion process and start the vehicle. Key features to consider when replacing a starter include its amperage draw and whether it uses a gear reduction design for increased torque. The price for a starter typically ranges from $120 to over $210.

car_parts.name: THERMOSTAT

summary.function: Regulates the engine's operating temperature by controlling the flow of coolant.
summary.key_features: Opening temperature.

car_parts.corpus: A Thermostat is a small valve in the cooling system that functions to regulate the engine's operating temperature. It does this by controlling the flow of coolant to the radiator. The primary key feature of a thermostat is its specified opening temperature, which determines when it will allow coolant to flow. The price for this part is generally low, ranging from $6 to over $25.

car_parts.name: VALVE LIFTER

summary.function: Rides on the camshaft and pushes the pushrod up to open the valve.
summary.key_features: Hydraulic vs. solid lifters.

car_parts.corpus: A Valve Lifter, or tappet, is a component that rides on the camshaft lobe. Its function is to transfer the lifting motion from the camshaft to the pushrod (in overhead valve engines) to open the valve. A key feature is its type, with hydraulic lifters being common for quiet operation and solid lifters often used in high-performance applications. Prices can range from $4 to over $440.

car_parts.name: BRAKE CALIPER

summary.function: Squeezes the brake pads against the brake rotor to slow the vehicle down.
summary.key_features: Floating vs. fixed calipers, number of pistons.

car_parts.corpus: The Brake Caliper is a hydraulic clamp in a disc brake system. Its function is to squeeze the brake pads against the spinning brake rotor, creating the friction needed to slow the vehicle down. Key features include the type of caliper (floating or fixed) and the number of pistons it contains, which affects clamping force and performance. The price of a brake caliper varies by vehicle.

car_parts.name: BRAKE PAD

summary.function: Creates friction against the brake rotor to slow the vehicle down.
summary.key_features: Material (ceramic, semi-metallic, organic).

car_parts.corpus: Brake Pads are the consumable friction material in a disc brake system. Their function is to press against the brake rotor to create friction and slow the vehicle. The most important key feature is their material composition, which can be ceramic, semi-metallic, or organic, each offering different characteristics in terms of noise, dust, and performance. The price of brake pads varies widely by vehicle.

car_parts.name: BRAKE ROTOR

summary.function: The disc that the brake pads clamp onto to slow the vehicle down.
summary.key_features: Solid vs. vented, drilled or slotted for performance.

car_parts.corpus: The Brake Rotor (or disc) is the circular plate that the brake pads clamp onto. Its function is to provide a surface for the brake pads to create friction against, converting kinetic energy into heat to slow the vehicle. Key features include its design (solid or vented for cooling) and whether it is drilled or slotted for enhanced performance. The price of brake rotors varies by vehicle.

car_parts.name: VACUUM BRAKE BOOSTER

summary.function: Uses engine vacuum to multiply the force applied to the brake pedal, making it easier to brake.
summary.key_features: Single or dual diaphragm.

car_parts.corpus: A Vacuum Brake Booster is a device that functions to make braking easier by using engine vacuum to multiply the force applied to the brake pedal by the driver. A key feature is its design, which can be either a single or dual diaphragm, with dual diaphragms providing more assistance. The price in India can range from ₹550 to over ₹12,345.

car_parts.name: COIL SPRING

summary.function: Supports the weight of the vehicle and absorbs bumps in the road.
summary.key_features: Spring rate, ride height.

car_parts.corpus: A Coil Spring is a fundamental component of a vehicle's suspension system. Its function is to support the weight of the vehicle and to absorb bumps and imperfections in the road, providing a comfortable ride. Key features to consider are the spring rate, which determines its stiffness, and its length, which affects the vehicle's ride height. The price of coil springs varies by vehicle.

car_parts.name: IDLER ARM

summary.function: A pivoting support for the steering linkage in vehicles with parallelogram steering.
summary.key_features: Greasable vs. sealed design.

car_parts.corpus: An Idler Arm is a component found in the steering linkage of vehicles with a parallelogram steering design (common in older cars and trucks). Its function is to act as a pivoting support for the steering linkage on the passenger side of the vehicle. A key feature is whether it has a greasable or a sealed-for-life design. The price of an idler arm varies by vehicle.

car_parts.name: LEAF SPRING

summary.function: A type of spring used in the rear suspension of many trucks and SUVs.
summary.key_features: Number of leaves, load capacity.

car_parts.corpus: A Leaf Spring is a type of spring commonly used in the rear suspension of trucks and SUVs. Its function is to support the vehicle's weight and control the axle's position. Key features include the number of leaves in the spring pack and its overall load capacity, which determines how much weight it can effectively support. The price in India ranges from ₹70 per kilogram to over ₹15,000 for a complete assembly.

car_parts.name: LOWER CONTROL ARM

summary.function: A suspension link that connects the wheel hub and steering knuckle to the frame.
summary.key_features: Bushing material, with or without ball joint.

car_parts.corpus: A Lower Control Arm is a crucial suspension link that functions to connect the wheel hub and steering knuckle to the vehicle's frame. It allows the wheel to move up and down while maintaining proper alignment. Key features include the material of its bushings and whether it comes pre-assembled with a ball joint. The price in India ranges from ₹575 to over ₹4,000.

car_parts.name: BATTERY

summary.function: Provides electrical power to start the engine and run the electronics when the engine is off.
summary.key_features: Cold Cranking Amps (CCA), reserve capacity, battery type (lead-acid, AGM).

car_parts.corpus: The vehicle Battery is an energy storage device whose primary function is to provide the electrical power needed to start the engine. It also powers the vehicle's electronics when the engine is off. Key features to consider are its Cold Cranking Amps (CCA), reserve capacity, and its type (such as traditional lead-acid or modern AGM). Prices in India can range from ₹18,800 to over ₹58,300.

car_parts.name: CARBURETOR

summary.function: Mixes air and fuel for internal combustion engines (found in older vehicles).
summary.key_features: Barrel count, choke type.

car_parts.corpus: A Carburetor is a mechanical device found in older vehicles whose function is to mix air and fuel in the correct ratio for the internal combustion engine. Key features of a carburetor include its barrel count (e.g., two-barrel or four-barrel) and the type of choke it uses (manual or automatic). The price varies depending on the specific vehicle and carburetor type.

car_parts.name: FUSE BOX

summary.function: Houses the fuses that protect the vehicle's electrical circuits.
summary.key_features: Number of circuits, fuse types.

car_parts.corpus: A Fuse Box, or fuse panel, is a central housing for the fuses that protect the vehicle's various electrical circuits. Its function is to prevent damage from overcurrents by having a fuse blow and interrupt the circuit. Key features are the number of circuits it supports and the types of fuses it uses. Prices in India can range from ₹206 to ₹1,349.

car_parts.name: GAS CAP

summary.function: Seals the fuel tank to prevent fuel vapors from escaping.
summary.key_features: Vented vs. non-vented, locking vs. non-locking.

car_parts.corpus: The Gas Cap's function is to seal the fuel tank filler neck. This prevents fuel vapors from escaping into the atmosphere and stops dirt and moisture from entering the tank. Key features include whether it is a vented or non-vented design and if it has a locking mechanism for security. Prices can range from $6 to over $100.

car_parts.name: HEADLIGHTS

summary.function: Illuminate the road ahead.
summary.key_features: Halogen, LED, or HID bulbs, projector vs. reflector style.

car_parts.corpus: Headlights are the primary forward-facing lights on a vehicle, with the crucial function of illuminating the road ahead at night or in poor visibility. Key features include the type of bulb technology used (Halogen, LED, or HID) and the style of the housing (projector or reflector), which affects the beam pattern. Prices can range dramatically from ₹5,000 to over ₹850,000 for high-end systems.

car_parts.name: MUFFLER

summary.function: Reduces the noise from the engine's exhaust.
summary.key_features: Chambered, turbo, or straight-through design for different sound levels.

car_parts.corpus: A Muffler is a component of the vehicle's exhaust system with the function of reducing the noise generated by the engine's combustion process. Key features include its internal design, which can be chambered, turbo, or straight-through, each offering a different sound level and performance characteristic. The price of a muffler varies by vehicle and design.

car_parts.name: OVERFLOW TANK

summary.function: A reservoir for excess coolant from the radiator.
summary.key_features: Capacity, material (plastic).

car_parts.corpus: The Overflow Tank, or coolant reservoir, functions as a reservoir for excess coolant that expands out of the radiator as the engine heats up. Key features are its capacity and its material, which is typically a durable plastic. The price for this component can range from as little as $2 to over $900 for specialized applications.

car_parts.name: RADIATOR

summary.function: Cools the engine coolant by transferring heat to the air.
summary.key_features: Core material (aluminum or copper-brass), number of rows.

car_parts.corpus: The Radiator is the main component of the engine's cooling system. Its function is to cool the engine coolant by transferring heat from the coolant to the air passing through it. Key features include the material of its core (aluminum or copper-brass) and the number of rows in the core, which affects its cooling efficiency. Prices in India range from ₹800 to ₹8,500.

car_parts.name: RADIATOR FAN

summary.function: Pulls air through the radiator to cool the coolant, especially when the vehicle is stationary.
summary.key_features: Electric vs. clutch fan.

car_parts.corpus: The Radiator Fan's function is to pull air through the radiator to cool the coolant, which is especially important when the vehicle is stationary or moving slowly. A key feature is its type, which can be an electric fan controlled by the engine's computer or a mechanical clutch fan driven by the engine's belt. The price varies by vehicle and fan type.

car_parts.name: RADIATOR HOSE

summary.function: Carries coolant between the engine and the radiator.
summary.key_features: Molded vs. flexible hose.

car_parts.corpus: A Radiator Hose is a flexible tube that functions to carry coolant between the engine and the radiator. Key features include whether it is a molded hose, specifically shaped for a particular vehicle, or a flexible hose that can be adapted to fit. Prices in India range from ₹300 to ₹6,750.

car_parts.name: RIM

summary.function: The outer edge of a wheel that holds the tire.
summary.key_features: Material (steel, alloy, carbon fiber), size (diameter and width), bolt pattern.

car_parts.corpus: A Rim, or wheel, is the component that holds the tire. Its function is to provide a mounting point for the tire and connect it to the vehicle's axle hub. Key features include its material (steel, alloy, or carbon fiber), its size (diameter and width), and its bolt pattern, which must match the vehicle's hub. The price per rim in India can range from ₹450 to over ₹22,000.

car_parts.name: TAILLIGHTS

summary.function: Provide visibility from the rear of the vehicle and indicate braking and turning.
summary.key_features: LED, halogen, or incandescent bulbs.

car_parts.corpus: Taillights are the rear-facing lights on a vehicle. Their function is to provide visibility from the rear and to indicate the driver's actions, such as braking and turning. Key features include the type of bulbs they use, such as traditional halogen, incandescent, or modern, brighter LED bulbs. The price for taillight assemblies in India can range from ₹786 to over ₹45,000.

car_parts.name: TORQUE CONVERTER

summary.function: A fluid coupling that transfers power from the engine to the transmission in automatic vehicles.
summary.key_features: Stall speed.

car_parts.corpus: A Torque Converter is a component found in vehicles with automatic transmissions. It functions as a fluid coupling that transfers rotational power from the engine to the transmission, allowing the engine to idle while the vehicle is stopped. A key performance feature is its stall speed, which is the engine RPM at which it will overcome the vehicle's brakes. The price for the part alone typically ranges from $150 to over $500.

car_parts.name: TRANSMISSION

summary.function: Transmits power from the engine to the wheels.
summary.key_features: Automatic vs. manual, number of gears.

car_parts.corpus: The Transmission is a major component of the drivetrain whose function is to transmit power from the engine to the wheels. It allows the gear ratio between the engine and the drive wheels to be changed as the car speeds up and slows down. Key features are its type (automatic or manual) and the number of gears it has. The price of a transmission varies significantly by vehicle.

car_parts.name: AIR COMPRESSOR

summary.function: Compresses air for various systems, including air suspension and air conditioning.
summary.key_features: Horsepower (HP), air tank capacity, and maximum flow rate.

car_parts.corpus: An Air Compressor is a mechanical device in a vehicle that serves the function of compressing air for use in various systems, such as air suspension and air conditioning. Key features to consider when choosing one include its horsepower (HP), the capacity of its air tank, and its maximum flow rate, which together determine its performance. The price for an automotive air compressor can range widely from ₹800 to over ₹20,000.

car_parts.name: ALTERNATOR

summary.function: Charges the battery and powers the electrical system when the engine is running.
summary.key_features: Amperage output, compatibility with your vehicle.

car_parts.corpus: The Alternator is a critical component of a vehicle's electrical system. Its function is to charge the battery while the engine is running and to power the vehicle's entire electrical system. When replacing an alternator, key features to consider are its amperage output, which must meet the vehicle's electrical demands, and ensuring it is compatible with the specific vehicle model. Prices can range from ₹10,000 to over ₹85,000.

car_parts.name: CAMSHAFT

summary.function: Controls the opening and closing of the engine's valves.
summary.key_features: Lift and duration for performance applications.
summary.price: Prices vary widely based on the vehicle and type of camshaft.

car_parts.corpus: A Camshaft is a rotating shaft within an engine whose function is to control the opening and closing of the engine's intake and exhaust valves. In performance applications, the key features to consider are the camshaft's lift and duration, which determine how far the valves open and for how long, directly impacting the engine's power characteristics. The price of a camshaft varies widely based on the vehicle and the type of camshaft.

car_parts.name: CRANKSHAFT

summary.function: Converts the linear motion of the pistons into rotational motion.
summary.key_features: Forged vs. cast construction for strength.

car_parts.corpus: The Crankshaft is a fundamental engine component that functions to convert the linear, up-and-down motion of the pistons into the rotational motion needed to power the vehicle. A key feature to consider, especially for high-performance engines, is its construction material, with forged crankshafts offering greater strength and durability compared to cast ones. The price can range from as low as ₹150 to over ₹38,000.

car_parts.name: CYLINDER HEAD

summary.function: Sits on top of the engine block and houses the valves, spark plugs, and fuel injectors.
summary.key_features: Material (aluminum or cast iron), port design.

car_parts.corpus: The Cylinder Head is a major engine component that sits on top of the engine block. Its function is to house crucial parts like the valves, spark plugs, and fuel injectors, and to form the top of the combustion chamber. Key features to consider include its material, typically aluminum or cast iron, and the design of its intake and exhaust ports, which affect airflow and performance. The price of a cylinder head varies greatly by vehicle.

car_parts.name: DISTRIBUTOR

summary.function: Distributes high voltage from the ignition coil to the spark plugs in the correct firing order.
summary.key_features: Electronic vs. points-based systems.

car_parts.corpus: Found in older vehicles with non-electronic ignition systems, the Distributor's function is to route the high voltage from the ignition coil to the spark plugs in the correct firing order. A key feature is the type of system it uses, with older vehicles using points-based systems and later models using more reliable electronic systems. The price of a distributor varies depending on the specific vehicle.

car_parts.name: ENGINE BLOCK

summary.function: The main structure of the engine that houses the cylinders and other major components.
summary.key_features: Material (cast iron or aluminum), deck height, bore size.

car_parts.corpus: The Engine Block is the core foundation of an internal combustion engine. Its primary function is to house the cylinders and provide a rigid structure for all other major engine components to attach to. Key features of an engine block include its material (cast iron or aluminum), its deck height, and its cylinder bore size, which all play a role in the engine's overall design and potential. The price varies significantly depending on the engine.

car_parts.name: FUEL INJECTOR

summary.function: Sprays fuel into the engine's cylinders.
summary.key_features: Flow rate, impedance.

car_parts.corpus: A Fuel Injector is a precision component whose function is to spray a fine mist of fuel into the engine's cylinders or intake manifold. Key features to consider when selecting fuel injectors are their flow rate, which must match the engine's fuel requirements, and their impedance (high or low), which must be compatible with the vehicle's engine control unit. The price per injector can range from $12 to over $155.

car_parts.name: IGNITION COIL

summary.function: Transforms the battery's low voltage to the high voltage needed to create a spark.
summary.key_features: Coil-on-plug vs. distributor-based systems.

car_parts.corpus: The Ignition Coil's function is to act as a high-voltage transformer, converting the battery's low 12-volt current into the thousands of volts needed to create a spark at the spark plug. A key feature is the type of ignition system it's designed for, such as modern coil-on-plug systems or older distributor-based systems. The price for an ignition coil varies depending on the vehicle.

car_parts.name: OIL FILTER

summary.function: Removes contaminants from the engine oil.
summary.key_features: Filtration efficiency, capacity.

car_parts.corpus: An Oil Filter is a disposable component with the crucial function of removing contaminants, such as dirt and metal particles, from the engine oil. Key features to consider when choosing an oil filter are its filtration efficiency, which indicates how well it cleans the oil, and its capacity. Prices for oil filters in India typically range from ₹900 to over ₹2,400.

car_parts.name: OIL PAN

summary.function: Reservoir for the engine oil at the bottom of the engine.
summary.key_features: Material (steel or aluminum), capacity.

car_parts.corpus: The Oil Pan is located at the bottom of the engine and functions as a reservoir for the engine oil. Key features to consider include its material, which is typically steel or aluminum, and its capacity, as a larger capacity can aid in cooling and ensure adequate oil supply during aggressive driving. The price of an oil pan varies by vehicle.

car_parts.name: OXYGEN SENSOR

summary.function: Measures the amount of oxygen in the exhaust gases to help the engine run efficiently.
summary.key_features: Upstream or downstream sensor, connector type.

car_parts.corpus: An Oxygen Sensor is a critical emissions control device whose function is to measure the amount of unburned oxygen in the exhaust gases. This data helps the engine's computer adjust the air-fuel mixture for optimal efficiency and minimal emissions. Key features include its location (upstream before the catalytic converter, or downstream after it) and its specific connector type. The price varies by vehicle.

car_parts.name: PISTON

summary.function: Moves up and down in the cylinder to compress the air-fuel mixture and transmit power to the crankshaft.
summary.key_features: Forged or cast, compression ratio.

car_parts.corpus: A Piston is a cylindrical component that moves up and down within an engine's cylinder. Its function is to compress the air-fuel mixture and to transmit the force of combustion down to the crankshaft via a connecting rod. Key features include its construction (forged or cast) and its design, which affects the engine's compression ratio. The price for a piston can range from ₹270 to over ₹50,000.

car_parts.name: SPARK PLUG

summary.function: Creates a spark to ignite the air-fuel mixture in the cylinder.
summary.key_features: Material (copper, platinum, iridium), heat range.

car_parts.corpus: A Spark Plug is a small but essential device whose function is to create an electrical spark to ignite the compressed air-fuel mixture inside the cylinder. Key features to consider are the electrode material (copper, platinum, or iridium, which affects longevity) and the plug's heat range, which must match the engine's operating conditions. The price in India can range from ₹60 to over ₹3,500.

car_parts.name: STARTER

summary.function: An electric motor that turns the engine over to start it.
summary.key_features: Amperage draw, gear reduction.

car_parts.corpus: The Starter is an electric motor with the sole function of turning the engine over (cranking it) to initiate the combustion process and start the vehicle. Key features to consider when replacing a starter include its amperage draw and whether it uses a gear reduction design for increased torque. The price for a starter typically ranges from $120 to over $210.

car_parts.name: THERMOSTAT

summary.function: Regulates the engine's operating temperature by controlling the flow of coolant.
summary.key_features: Opening temperature.

car_parts.corpus: A Thermostat is a small valve in the cooling system that functions to regulate the engine's operating temperature. It does this by controlling the flow of coolant to the radiator. The primary key feature of a thermostat is its specified opening temperature, which determines when it will allow coolant to flow. The price for this part is generally low, ranging from $6 to over $25.

car_parts.name: VALVE LIFTER

summary.function: Rides on the camshaft and pushes the pushrod up to open the valve.
summary.key_features: Hydraulic vs. solid lifters.

car_parts.corpus: A Valve Lifter, or tappet, is a component that rides on the camshaft lobe. Its function is to transfer the lifting motion from the camshaft to the pushrod (in overhead valve engines) to open the valve. A key feature is its type, with hydraulic lifters being common for quiet operation and solid lifters often used in high-performance applications. Prices can range from $4 to over $440.

car_parts.name: BRAKE CALIPER

summary.function: Squeezes the brake pads against the brake rotor to slow the vehicle down.
summary.key_features: Floating vs. fixed calipers, number of pistons.

car_parts.corpus: The Brake Caliper is a hydraulic clamp in a disc brake system. Its function is to squeeze the brake pads against the spinning brake rotor, creating the friction needed to slow the vehicle down. Key features include the type of caliper (floating or fixed) and the number of pistons it contains, which affects clamping force and performance. The price of a brake caliper varies by vehicle.

car_parts.name: BRAKE PAD

summary.function: Creates friction against the brake rotor to slow the vehicle down.
summary.key_features: Material (ceramic, semi-metallic, organic).

car_parts.corpus: Brake Pads are the consumable friction material in a disc brake system. Their function is to press against the brake rotor to create friction and slow the vehicle. The most important key feature is their material composition, which can be ceramic, semi-metallic, or organic, each offering different characteristics in terms of noise, dust, and performance. The price of brake pads varies widely by vehicle.

car_parts.name: BRAKE ROTOR

summary.function: The disc that the brake pads clamp onto to slow the vehicle down.
summary.key_features: Solid vs. vented, drilled or slotted for performance.

car_parts.corpus: The Brake Rotor (or disc) is the circular plate that the brake pads clamp onto. Its function is to provide a surface for the brake pads to create friction against, converting kinetic energy into heat to slow the vehicle. Key features include its design (solid or vented for cooling) and whether it is drilled or slotted for enhanced performance. The price of brake rotors varies by vehicle.

car_parts.name: VACUUM BRAKE BOOSTER

summary.function: Uses engine vacuum to multiply the force applied to the brake pedal, making it easier to brake.
summary.key_features: Single or dual diaphragm.

car_parts.corpus: A Vacuum Brake Booster is a device that functions to make braking easier by using engine vacuum to multiply the force applied to the brake pedal by the driver. A key feature is its design, which can be either a single or dual diaphragm, with dual diaphragms providing more assistance. The price in India can range from ₹550 to over ₹12,345.

car_parts.name: COIL SPRING

summary.function: Supports the weight of the vehicle and absorbs bumps in the road.
summary.key_features: Spring rate, ride height.

car_parts.corpus: A Coil Spring is a fundamental component of a vehicle's suspension system. Its function is to support the weight of the vehicle and to absorb bumps and imperfections in the road, providing a comfortable ride. Key features to consider are the spring rate, which determines its stiffness, and its length, which affects the vehicle's ride height. The price of coil springs varies by vehicle.

car_parts.name: IDLER ARM

summary.function: A pivoting support for the steering linkage in vehicles with parallelogram steering.
summary.key_features: Greasable vs. sealed design.

car_parts.corpus: An Idler Arm is a component found in the steering linkage of vehicles with a parallelogram steering design (common in older cars and trucks). Its function is to act as a pivoting support for the steering linkage on the passenger side of the vehicle. A key feature is whether it has a greasable or a sealed-for-life design. The price of an idler arm varies by vehicle.

car_parts.name: LEAF SPRING

summary.function: A type of spring used in the rear suspension of many trucks and SUVs.
summary.key_features: Number of leaves, load capacity.

car_parts.corpus: A Leaf Spring is a type of spring commonly used in the rear suspension of trucks and SUVs. Its function is to support the vehicle's weight and control the axle's position. Key features include the number of leaves in the spring pack and its overall load capacity, which determines how much weight it can effectively support. The price in India ranges from ₹70 per kilogram to over ₹15,000 for a complete assembly.

car_parts.name: LOWER CONTROL ARM

summary.function: A suspension link that connects the wheel hub and steering knuckle to the frame.
summary.key_features: Bushing material, with or without ball joint.

car_parts.corpus: A Lower Control Arm is a crucial suspension link that functions to connect the wheel hub and steering knuckle to the vehicle's frame. It allows the wheel to move up and down while maintaining proper alignment. Key features include the material of its bushings and whether it comes pre-assembled with a ball joint. The price in India ranges from ₹575 to over ₹4,000.

car_parts.name: BATTERY

summary.function: Provides electrical power to start the engine and run the electronics when the engine is off.
summary.key_features: Cold Cranking Amps (CCA), reserve capacity, battery type (lead-acid, AGM).

car_parts.corpus: The vehicle Battery is an energy storage device whose primary function is to provide the electrical power needed to start the engine. It also powers the vehicle's electronics when the engine is off. Key features to consider are its Cold Cranking Amps (CCA), reserve capacity, and its type (such as traditional lead-acid or modern AGM). Prices in India can range from ₹18,800 to over ₹58,300.

summary.key_features: Barrel count, choke type.

car_parts.corpus: A Carburetor is a mechanical device found in older vehicles whose function is to mix air and fuel in the correct ratio for the internal combustion engine. Key features of a carburetor include its barrel count (e.g., two-barrel or four-barrel) and the type of choke it uses (manual or automatic). The price varies depending on the specific vehicle and carburetor type.

summary.key_features: Number of circuits, fuse types.

car_parts.corpus: A Fuse Box, or fuse panel, is a central housing for the fuses that protect the vehicle's various electrical circuits. Its function is to prevent damage from overcurrents by having a fuse blow and interrupt the circuit. Key features are the number of circuits it supports and the types of fuses it uses. Key features include its internal design, which can be chambered, turbo, or straight-through, each offering a different sound level and performance characteristic. summary.function: A reservoir for excess coolant from the radiator.
summary.key_features: Capacity, material (plastic).

car_parts.corpus: The Overflow Tank, or coolant reservoir, functions as a reservoir for excess coolant that expands out of the radiator as the engine heats up. Key features are its capacity and its material, which is typically a durable plastic. The price for this component can range from as little as $2 to over $900 for specialized applications.

car_parts.name: RADIATOR

summary.function: Cools the engine coolant by transferring heat to the air.
summary.key_features: Core material (aluminum or copper-brass), number of rows.

car_parts.corpus: The Radiator is the main component of the engine's cooling system. Its function is to cool the engine coolant by transferring heat from the coolant to the air passing through it. Key features include the material of its core (aluminum or copper-brass) and the number of rows in the core, which affects its cooling efficiency. Prices in India range from ₹800 to ₹8,500.

summary.function: Pulls air through the radiator to cool the coolant, especially when the vehicle is stationary.
summary.key_features: Electric vs. clutch fan.

car_parts.corpus: The Radiator Fan's function is to pull air through the radiator to cool the coolant, which is especially important when the vehicle is stationary or moving slowly. A key feature is its type, which can be an electric fan controlled by the engine's computer or a mechanical clutch fan driven by the engine's belt. The price varies by vehicle and fan type.

summary.key_features: Molded vs. flexible hose.

car_parts.corpus: A Radiator Hose is a flexible tube that functions to carry coolant between the engine and the radiator. summary.function: The outer edge of a wheel that holds the tire.
summary.key_features: Material (steel, alloy, carbon fiber), size (diameter and width), bolt pattern.

car_parts.corpus: A Rim, or wheel, is the component that holds the tire. Its function is to provide a mounting point for the tire and connect it to the vehicle's axle hub. summary.key_features: LED, halogen, or incandescent bulbs.

car_parts.name: TORQUE CONVERTER

summary.function: A fluid coupling that transfers power from the engine to the transmission in automatic vehicles.
summary.key_features: Stall speed.

car_parts.corpus: A Torque Converter is a component found in vehicles with automatic transmissions. It functions as a fluid coupling that transfers rotational power from the engine to the transmission, allowing the engine to idle while the vehicle is stopped. car_parts.name: TRANSMISSION

summary.function: Transmits power from the engine to the wheels.
summary.key_features: Automatic vs. manual, number of gears.

car_parts.corpus: The Transmission is a major component of the drivetrain whose function is to transmit power from the engine to the wheels. It allows the gear ratio between the engine and the drive wheels to be changed as the car speeds up and slows down. Key features are its type (automatic or manual) and the number of gears it has. The price of a transmission varies significantly by vehicle.

car_parts.name: TIMING BELT / CHAIN

summary.function: Synchronizes the rotation of the crankshaft and camshaft(s).
summary.key_features: Material (rubber belt vs. metal chain), interference vs. non-interference engine design consideration.
summary.price: Varies greatly; $20-$100 for the part, $500-$1500+ for replacement service.

car_parts.corpus: The timing belt or timing chain is an absolutely critical engine component whose function is to synchronize the rotation of the crankshaft and the camshafts. This precise timing ensures that the engine's valves open and close at the correct moments in relation to the piston's movement. A key distinction is the material: timing belts are made of a reinforced rubber composite and require replacement at specified intervals (e.g., every 60,000-100,000 miles), while timing chains are metal and designed to last the life of the engine, though they can stretch or their tensioners can fail over time. The most critical consideration is whether the vehicle has an 'interference' engine. On these engines, a failed belt or chain can cause the pistons to collide with the open valves, resulting in catastrophic and expensive engine damage. This makes adhering to the replacement schedule paramount for interference engines.

car_parts.name: CATALYTIC CONVERTER

summary.function: Converts toxic pollutants in exhaust gas into less-toxic substances.
summary.key_features: Catalyst materials (platinum, palladium, rhodium), substrate type (ceramic or metallic), direct-fit vs. universal.

car_parts.corpus: The catalytic converter is a vital part of a modern vehicle's exhaust and emissions control system. Its primary function is to act as a chemical catalyst, converting harmful exhaust pollutants like carbon monoxide (CO), hydrocarbons (HC), and nitrogen oxides (NOx) into less harmful substances such as carbon dioxide (CO2), nitrogen (N2), and water (H2O). Inside the converter is a honeycomb-like substrate, typically ceramic, which is coated with a wash of precious metals—platinum, palladium, and rhodium—that facilitate the chemical reactions. Because of the high value of these metals, catalytic converters are unfortunately a common target for theft. Key features to consider when replacing one are whether it is a direct-fit model designed for a specific vehicle, or a universal one that requires welding and modification. A failing converter can cause reduced engine performance, a 'rotten egg' smell from the exhaust, and will trigger a check engine light, often with the diagnostic trouble code P0420.

car_parts.name: FUEL PUMP

summary.function: Pushes or draws fuel from the gas tank to the engine's fuel injectors or carburetor.
summary.key_features: In-tank vs. external design, flow rate (LPH), operating pressure (PSI).

car_parts.corpus: The fuel pump is an essential component responsible for delivering a steady supply of fuel from the vehicle's tank to the engine. In virtually all modern vehicles, this is an electric pump located inside the fuel tank itself (an in-tank design). This placement helps cool the pump and reduces noise. Its function is to supply fuel at a specific volume, measured in liters per hour (LPH), and at a constant operating pressure, measured in PSI, to ensure the fuel injectors can operate correctly. A failing fuel pump presents several distinct symptoms, including difficulty starting the engine, hesitation or sputtering during acceleration, a distinct whining noise from the rear of the vehicle where the tank is located, or a complete loss of power. The fuel pump is often part of a larger module that includes the fuel level sending unit, which is the sensor that reports the fuel level to the dashboard gauge.

car_parts.name: CV AXLE

summary.function: Transmits power from the transaxle to the wheels at a constant rotational speed, regardless of steering angle.
summary.key_features: Inner and outer CV joints, protective rubber boot condition.

car_parts.corpus: The Constant Velocity (CV) axle is a drivetrain component essential to all front-wheel-drive and most all-wheel-drive vehicles. Its function is to transmit torque from the vehicle's transmission or transaxle to the drive wheels at a constant speed, even as the wheels turn and the suspension moves up and down. Each axle shaft has two CV joints: an inner joint connecting to the transmission and an outer joint connecting to the wheel. The most common point of failure is not the joint itself, but the flexible rubber boot that protects it. This boot holds lubricating grease in and keeps dirt and moisture out. Once the boot tears, the grease is flung out and contaminants enter, quickly causing the joint to wear out and fail. The classic tell-tale sign of a failing outer CV joint is a rhythmic clicking or popping sound that is most prominent when making sharp turns.

car_parts.name: MASS AIRFLOW (MAF) SENSOR

summary.function: Measures the mass of air entering a fuel-injected internal combustion engine.
summary.key_features: Hot wire or hot film type, placement in the intake tract.

car_parts.corpus: The Mass Airflow (MAF) sensor is a key sensor in the engine management system of modern fuel-injected vehicles. Its function is to accurately measure the mass—not just the volume—of air entering the engine's intake manifold. The Engine Control Unit (ECU) relies heavily on this data to calculate the precise amount of fuel to inject, ensuring the optimal air-fuel ratio for clean combustion and efficient performance. Most MAF sensors are of the 'hot wire' or 'hot film' type; they work by heating a small electronic element and then measuring the electrical current required to maintain its temperature as air flows past and cools it. When a MAF sensor becomes dirty or fails, it can send inaccurate data to the ECU, leading to a host of problems like a rough idle, engine hesitation or stalling, poor acceleration, and a noticeable decrease in fuel economy. Often, a specific check engine light code will be stored, and sometimes the sensor can be carefully cleaned to restore its function before a full replacement is necessary.
